 Serif; color: #171717&gt;50,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%; line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; color: #171717&gt;5&lt;sup&gt;th&lt;/sup&gt;, 6&lt;sup&gt;th&lt;/sup&gt; and 7&lt;sup&gt;th&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; color: #171717&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right; line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; color: #171717&gt;75,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; color: #171717&gt;8&lt;sup&gt;th&lt;/sup&gt; and 9&lt;sup&gt;th&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; color: #171717&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right; line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; color: #171717&gt;100,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; color: #171717&gt;10&lt;sup&gt;th&lt;/sup&gt; and thereafter&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; color: #171717&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right; line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; color: #171717&gt;125,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company incurred $203,031 and $134,121&#13;of royalty expenses for the years ended December 31, 2013 and 2012, respectively. Royalty expenses are included in general and&#13;administrative expenses on the Statement of Operations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;Agreements with Placement Agents and Finders&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;(A) December 1, 2011&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company entered into a Financial Advisory&#13;and Investment Banking Agreement with Spartan Capital Securities, LLC (&amp;#147;Spartan&amp;#148;) effective December 1, 2011 (the &amp;#147;Spartan&#13;Advisory Agreement&amp;#148;). Pursuant to the Spartan Advisory Agreement, Spartan will act as the Company&amp;#146;s exclusive financial&#13;advisor and placement agent to assist the Company in connection with a best efforts private placement (the &amp;#147;Financing&amp;#148;)&#13;of up to $6 million of the Company&amp;#146;s equity and/or debt securities and/or convertible instruments (the &amp;#147;Securities&amp;#148;).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company upon closing of the Financing shall&#13;pay consideration to Spartan, in cash, a fee in an amount equal to 10% of the aggregate gross proceeds raised in the Financing.&#13;The Company shall grant and deliver to Spartan at the closing of the Financing, for nominal consideration, five year warrants (the&#13;&amp;#147;Warrants&amp;#148;) to purchase a number of shares of the Company&amp;#146;s Common Stock equal to 10% of the number of shares&#13;of Common Stock (and/or shares of Common Stock issuable upon exercise of securities or upon conversion or exchange of convertible&#13;or exchangeable securities) sold at such closing. The Warrants shall be exercisable at any time during the five year period commencing&#13;on the closing to which they relate at an exercise price equal to the purchase price per share of Common Stock paid by investors&#13;in the Financing or, in the case of exercisable, convertible, or exchangeable securities, the exercise, conversion or exchange&#13;price thereof. If the Financing is consummated by means of more than one closing, Spartan shall be entitled to the fees provided&#13;herein with respect to each such closing.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Along with the above fees, the Company shall&#13;pay up to $40,000 for expenses incurred by Spartan in connection with this Financing, together with cost of background checks on&#13;the officers and directors of the Company.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;During the year ended 2012 the Company paid&#13;to Spartan fees of $505,400 and issued Spartan 505,400 five year warrants with an exercise price of $1.00.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;(B) May 2, 2013&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company entered into a second Financial&#13;Advisory and Investment Banking Agreement with Spartan Capital Securities, LLC (&amp;#147;Spartan&amp;#148;) effective May 2, 2013 (the&#13;&amp;#147;Spartan Advisory Agreement&amp;#148;). Pursuant to the Spartan Advisory Agreement, Spartan will act as the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;exclusive financial advisor and placement agent to assist the Company in connection with a best efforts private placement (the&#13;&amp;#147;Financing&amp;#148;) of up to $5 million of the Company&amp;#146;s equity and/or debt securities and/or convertible instruments&#13;(the &amp;#147;Securities&amp;#148;).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company upon closing of the Financing shall&#13;pay consideration to Spartan, in cash, a fee in an amount equal to 10% of the aggregate gross proceeds raised in the Financing&#13;and up to 3% of the aggregate gross proceeds raised in the Financing for expenses incurred by Spartan. The Company shall grant&#13;and deliver to Spartan at the closing of the Financing, for nominal consideration, five year warrants (the &amp;#147;Warrants&amp;#148;)&#13;to purchase a number of shares of the Company&amp;#146;s Common Stock equal to 10% of the number of shares of Common Stock (and/or&#13;shares of Common Stock issuable upon exercise of securities or upon conversion or exchange of convertible or exchangeable securities)&#13;sold at such closing. The Warrants shall be exercisable at any time during the five year period commencing on the closing to which&#13;they relate at an exercise price equal to the purchase price per share of Common Stock paid by investors in the Financing or, in&#13;the case of exercisable, convertible, or exchangeable securities, the exercise, conversion or exchange price thereof. If the Financing&#13;is consummated by means of more than one closing, Spartan shall be entitled to the fees provided herein with respect to each such&#13;closing.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company shall pay to Spartan a non-refundable&#13;monthly fee of $10,000 over a twelve to twenty four month period upon Spartan&amp;#146;s satisfaction of certain thresholds (raising&#13;of aggregate gross proceeds of $4.0mil-$5.0mil) outlined in the Spartan Advisory Agreement. On October 29, 2013 the Company entered&#13;into an amendment to the Agreement and the $10,000 monthly fee was cancelled.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;During the year ended December 31, 2013 the&#13;Company paid to Spartan fees of $650,000 and issued Spartan 333,333 five year warrants with an exercise price of $1.50.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;(C) October 22, 2013&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company entered into a third Financial&#13;Advisory and Investment Banking Agreement with Spartan Capital Securities, LLC (&amp;#147;Spartan&amp;#148;) effective October 22, 2013&#13;(the &amp;#147;Spartan Advisory Agreement&amp;#148;). Pursuant to the Spartan Advisory Agreement, Spartan will act, for a minimum of&#13;twenty-four months from the date of the agreement, as the Company&amp;#146;s exclusive financial advisor and placement agent to assist&#13;the Company in connection with a best efforts private placement (the &amp;#147;Financing&amp;#148;) of up to $2.5 million of the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;equity and/or debt securities and/or convertible instruments (the &amp;#147;Securities&amp;#148;).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company upon closing of the Financing shall&#13;pay consideration to Spartan, in cash, a fee in an amount equal to 10% of the aggregate gross proceeds raised in the Financing&#13;and 3% of the aggregate gross proceeds raised in the Financing for expenses incurred by Spartan. The Company shall grant and deliver&#13;to Spartan at the closing of the Financing, for nominal consideration, five year warrants (the &amp;#147;Warrants&amp;#148;) to purchase&#13;a number of shares of the Company&amp;#146;s Common Stock equal to 10% of the number of shares of Common Stock (and/or shares of Common&#13;Stock issuable upon exercise of securities or upon conversion or exchange of convertible or exchangeable securities) sold at such&#13;closing. The Warrants shall be exercisable at any time during the five year period commencing on the closing to which they relate&#13;at an exercise price equal to the purchase price per share of Common Stock paid by investors in the Financing or, in the case of&#13;exercisable, convertible, or exchangeable securities, the exercise, conversion or exchange price thereof. If the Financing is consummated&#13;by means of more than one closing, Spartan shall be entitled to the fees provided herein with respect to each such closing.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company shall pay to Spartan a non-refundable&#13;monthly fee of $10,000 for the term of the agreement. Such monthly fee shall survive any termination of the Agreement.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;During the year ended December 31, 2013 the&#13;Company paid to Spartan financing fees of $104,000 and issued Spartan 53,333 five year warrants with an exercise price of $1.50.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;Supply Agreement&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On October 3, 2011, the Company entered&#13;into a five year agreement with a non-related party manufacturer. Under the terms of the agreement, the Company grants to the manufacturer&#13;a revocable license to use the Company&amp;#146;s recipes, formulas, methods and ingredients for the preparation and production of&#13;Company&amp;#146;s products, for manufacturing the Company&amp;#146;s product and all future improvements, modifications, substitutions&#13;and replacements developed by the Company. The manufacturer in turn grants the Company the exclusive right to purchase the product.&#13;Under the terms of the agreement the manufacturer agrees to manufacture, package, and store the Company&amp;#146;s products and the&#13;Company has the right to purchase products from one or more other manufacturers, distributors or suppliers. The agreement contains&#13;a perpetual automatic renewal clause for additional periods of one year after the expiration of the initial term. During the renewal&#13;periods either party may cancel the contract with written notice nine months prior to the termination date.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Under the terms of the agreement if&#13;the Company specifies any change in packaging or shipping materials which results in the manufacturer incurring increased expense&#13;for packaging and shipping materials or in the manufacturer being unable to utilize obsolete packaging or shipping materials in&#13;ordinary packaging or shipping, the Company agrees to pay as additional product cost the additional cost for packaging and shipping&#13;materials and to purchase at cost such obsolete packaging and shipping materials. If the Company requests any repackaging of the&#13;product, other than due to defects in the original packaging, the Company will reimburse the manufacturer for any labor costs incurred&#13;in repackaging. Per the agreement all product delivery shipping costs are the expense of the Company.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Under the terms of the agreement, the&#13;Company is required to acquire and install production equipment at the manufacturer&amp;#146;s facility to be used solely for the&#13;manufacturing of the Company&amp;#146;s products. The manufacturer will bear all costs of operating and maintaining the production&#13;equipment during the period in which the manufacturer is manufacturing products pursuant to the agreement. The production equipment&#13;shall be owned by the Company.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;In order to continue the Exclusive term,&#13;the Company shall pay a minimum royalty with respect to the preceding Agreement year as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 10pt Calibri

 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Agreement Year&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: center; line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif; color: #171717&gt;-&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 79%; line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif; color: #171717&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 18%; text-align: right; line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif; color: #171717&gt;50,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%; line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif; color: #171717&gt;5&lt;sup&gt;th&lt;/sup&gt;, 6&lt;sup&gt;th&lt;/sup&gt; and 7&lt;sup&gt;th&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Times
 Serif; color: #171717&gt;75,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; color: #171717&gt;8&lt;sup&gt;th&lt;/sup&gt; and 9&lt;sup&gt;th&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; color: #171717&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right; line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; color: #171717&gt;100,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; color: #171717&gt;10&lt;sup&gt;th&lt;/sup&gt; and thereafter&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; color: #171717&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right; line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; color: #171717&gt;125,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;Note 4 - Credit Line&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On October 13, 2010 the Company signed&#13;a revolving note (the &amp;#147;Note&amp;#148;) with Provident Bank (the &amp;#147;Bank&amp;#148;) for $1,000,000. The available balance of&#13;this Note was reduced to $400,000 and extended to September 1, 2013. The outstanding balance accrues interest at a variable rate&#13;of 1.00% over the Wall Street Journal prime rate with a floor of 4.50% per annum. (Starting July 2013 the interest rate floor increased&#13;to 5%) Interest is payable monthly and the rate as of December 31, 2012 was 4.50%.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Advances are limited to 80% of eligible&#13;receivables (75 days from invoice) and 35% of finished goods inventory (Starting July 2013 advances are limited to 70% of eligible&#13;receivables). Inventory advances shall be capped at $250,000. Concentrations from any one customer exceeding 30% of total accounts&#13;receivable will be excluded from the borrowing base availability. The note is secured by accounts receivable, inventory, financial&#13;instruments, equipment, general intangibles and investment property and personal and unconditional guarantees of two of the shareholders&#13;of the Company.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;Note 5- Investment in LLC&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&lt;font style=background-color: yellow&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;During 2011 the Company acquired a 34.62%&#13;interest in Meatball Obsession, LLC (&amp;#147;MO&amp;#148;) for a total investment of $27,032. This investment is accounted for using&#13;the equity method of accounting. Accordingly, investments are recorded at acquisition cost plus the Company&amp;#146;s equity in the&#13;undistributed earnings or losses of the entity. At December 31, 2011 the investment was brought down to $0 due to losses incurred&#13;by MO.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;During 2012 the Company&amp;#146;s ownership&#13;interest in MO fell to 28% due to dilution.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;During 2013 the Company&amp;#146;s ownership&#13;interest in MO fell to 15.8% due to dilution.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;During the years ending December 31,&#13;2013 and 2012, sales to MO were $85,541 and $73,768, respectively. At December 31, 2013 and 2012 the accounts receivable balance&#13;from MO was $1,457 and $12,680, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;During 2013, the Company loaned MO $30,000&#13;for working capital purposes. The loan was non-interest bearing, unsecured and due on June 19, 2013. The loan was paid in full&#13;on July 8, 2013.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Summarized financial information for&#13;Meatball Obsession, LLC is as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 12pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times

 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;Note 6 - Related Party Transactions&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;b&gt;Supply Agreement&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On March 1, 2010, the Company entered&#13;into a five year agreement with a Manufacturer (the &amp;#147;Manufacturer&amp;#148;) who is a related party. The Manufacturer is owned&#13;by the CEO and President of the Company. Under the terms of the agreement, the Company grants to the Manufacturer a revocable license&#13;to use the Company&amp;#146;s recipes, formulas, methods and ingredients for the preparation and production of Company&amp;#146;s products,&#13;for manufacturing the Company&amp;#146;s product and all future improvements, modifications, substitutions and replacements developed&#13;by the Company. The Manufacturer in turn grants the Company the exclusive right to purchase the product. Under the terms of the&#13;agreement the Manufacturer agrees to manufacture, package, and store the Company&amp;#146;s products and the Company has the right&#13;to purchase products from one or more other manufacturers, distributors or suppliers. The agreement contains a perpetual automatic&#13;renewal clause for a period of one year after the expiration of the initial term. During the renewal period either party may cancel&#13;the contract with written notice nine months prior to the termination date.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Under the terms of the agreement if&#13;the Company specifies any change in packaging or shipping materials which results in the manufacturer incurring increased expense&#13;for packaging and shipping materials or in the Manufacturer being unable to utilize obsolete packaging or shipping materials in&#13;ordinary packaging or shipping, the Company agrees to pay as additional product cost the additional cost for packaging and shipping&#13;materials and to purchase at cost such obsolete packaging and shipping materials. If the Company requests any repackaging of the&#13;product, other than due to defects in the original packaging, the Company will reimburse the Manufacturer for any labor costs incurred&#13;in repackaging. Per the agreement, all product delivery shipping costs are the expense of the Company.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;During the years ended December 31,&#13;2013 and 2012, the Company purchased substantially all of it&amp;#146;s inventory from the Manufacturer. At December 31, 2013 and&#13;December 31, 2012, the Company has a deposit on inventory in the amount of $359,506 and $192,956, respectfully, to this Manufacturer.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;u&gt;Due from Manufacturer &amp;#150; related&#13;party&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;During years ended December 31, 2013&#13;and 2012,the Manufacturer received payments on behalf of the Company for the Company&amp;#146;s customer invoices and the Manufacturer&#13;incurred expenses on behalf of the Company for shared administrative expenses and salary expenses. In addition the Company made&#13;several unsecured loans to the Manufacturer during 2013. The loan to the Manufacturer is unsecured, does not bear interest and&#13;is due on demand. At December 31, 2013 and 2012 the amount due from the Manufacturer is as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 10pt Calibri
 Helvetica
 Sans-Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: center; line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: center; line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: center; line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;December 31, 2013&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: center; line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: center; line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: center; line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;December 31, 2012&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: center; line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 62%; line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;Note 11 - Subsequent Events&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company has evaluated all events that occurred&#13;after the balance sheet date through the date when the consolidated financial statements were issued to determine if they must&#13;be reported. The Management of the Company determined that there were certain reportable subsequent events to be disclosed as follow.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;Entry Into A Material Definitive Agreement&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Effective January 3, 2014, MamaMancini&amp;#146;s&#13;Inc. (&amp;#147;Mama&amp;#146;s&amp;#148;) a Delaware corporation and wholly owned subsidiary of MamaMancini&amp;#146;s Holdings, Inc. (the&#13;&amp;#147;Company&amp;#148;), entered into a Sale and Security Agreement (the &amp;#147;Sale and Security Agreement&amp;#148;) with Faunus&#13;Group International, Inc. (&amp;#147;FGI&amp;#148;) to provide for a $1.5 million secured demand credit facility backed by its receivables&#13;and inventory (the &amp;#147;FGI Facility&amp;#148;). The Sale and Security Agreement has an initial three (3) year term (the &amp;#147;Original&#13;Term&amp;#148;) and shall be extended automatically for an additional one (1) year for each succeeding term unless written notice&#13;of termination is given by either party at least sixty (60) days prior to the end of the Original Term or any extension thereof.&#13;The Company and certain of its affiliates also entered into guarantees to guarantee the performance of the obligations under the&#13;Sale and Security Agreement (the &amp;#147;Guaranty Agreements&amp;#148;). Mama&amp;#146;s also granted FGI a security interest in and lien&#13;upon all of Mama&amp;#146;s right, title and interest in and to all of Mama&amp;#146;s Collateral (as defined in the Sale and Security&#13;Agreement).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Pursuant to the FGI Facility, FGI can elect&#13;to purchase eligible accounts receivables (&amp;#147;Purchased Accounts&amp;#148;) up to 70% of the value of such receivables (retaining&#13;a 30% reserve). At FGI&amp;#146;s election, FGI may advance Mama&amp;#146;s up to 70% of the value of any Purchased Accounts, subject&#13;to the FGI Facility. Reserves retained by FGI on any Purchased Accounts are expected to be refunded to Mama&amp;#146;s net of interest&#13;and fees on advances once the receivables are collected from customers. The interest rate on advances or borrowings under the FGI&#13;Facility will be the greater of (i) 6.75% per annum and (ii) 2.50% above the rate of interest designated by FGI as its selected&#13;&amp;#147;Prime Rate&amp;#148; or &amp;#147;Base Rate&amp;#146;, as the case may be (which as of the date hereof is based upon the Wall Street&#13;Journal, Money Rates Section). Any advances or borrowings under the FGI Facility are due on demand.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Mama&amp;#146;s also agreed to pay to FGI monthly&#13;collateral management fees of 0.42% of the average monthly balance of Purchased Accounts. The minimum monthly net funds employed&#13;during each contract year hereof shall be $500,000. Additionally, Mama&amp;#146;s paid FGI a one-time facility fee equal to 1% of&#13;the FGI Facility upon entry into the Sale and Security Agreement.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;For further details please see the 8-K filed&#13;by the Company on January 10, 2014.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;Change of year end&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Effective January 13, 2014, MamaMancini&amp;#146;s&#13;Holdings, Inc. (the &amp;#147;Company&amp;#148;) changed its fiscal year-end date to January 31. The Company&amp;#146;s 2014 fiscal year&#13;shall commence on February 1, 2014 and conclude on January 31, 2015. The Company will file an Annual Report on Form 10-K for the&#13;year ended December 31, 2013 and will also file a transitional report with the United States Securities and Exchange Commission&#13;for the period of January 1, 2014 to January 31, 2014.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;Unregistered Sale of Equity Securities&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;Note 7 - Concentrations&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;Revenues&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times

 Times

 Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;b&gt;Cost of Sales&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;For the years ended December 31, 2013&#13;and 2012, the Company had the following concentrations of purchases from vendors:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 10pt Calibri
 Helvetica
 Sans-Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Vendor&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: center; line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: center; line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;December 31, 2013&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: center; line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: center; line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: center; line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;December 31, 2012&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: center; line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;A (Related Party)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right; line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;100&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right; line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Times
 Serif&gt;%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman

 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;Note 8 - Stockholders&amp;#146; Equity&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;(A) Common Stock Transactions&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;2012&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company issued 5,054,000 shares&#13;for cash proceeds of $5,054,000 ($1.00/share).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;2013&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;As a result of the reverse merger (see&#13;Note 1) the Company had a deemed issuance of 800,000 shares of common stock.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;From July 1, 2013 through December 31,&#13;2013, the Company issued 3,333,375 shares of common stock to investors in exchange for $5,000,000 in proceeds in connection with&#13;the private placement of the Company&amp;#146;s stock.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;u&gt;Common stock subscribed&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;In December 2013, the Company sold 533,333&#13;shares of common stock to investors in exchange for $800,000 in proceeds in connection with the private placement of the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;stock. As of December 31, 2013 the shares had not been issued.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;In connection with the 2013 private&#13;placement the Company incurred fees of $1,604,000 consisting of $872,106 in cash and 386,666 warrants with a fair value of $731,894.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;(B) Options&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times

 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;At December 31, 2013 and December 31,&#13;2012, the total intrinsic value of options outstanding and exercisable was $812,106 and $0, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;As of December 31, 2013, the Company&#13;has $90,931 in stock based compensation related to stock options that is yet to be vested. The weighted average expensing period&#13;of the unvested options is .8 years.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times

 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Property and equipment are recorded&#13;at cost. Depreciation expense is computed using straight-line methods over the estimated useful lives.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times

 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;Property and Equipment&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman

 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Property and equipment are recorded&#13;at cost. Depreciation expense is computed using straight-line methods over the estimated useful lives.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times

 Serif&gt;-&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;Note 1 - Nature of Operations and Basis of Presentation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;Nature of Operations&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;MamaMancini&amp;#146;s Holdings, Inc. (the &amp;#147;Company&amp;#148;),&#13;(formerly known as Mascot Properties, Inc.) was organized on July 22, 2009 as a Nevada corporation.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;Current Business of the Company&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company is a manufacturer and distributor&#13;of a line of beef meatballs with sauce, turkey meatballs with sauce, Italian sausage with sauce and other similar Italian meats&#13;with sauces. The Company&amp;#146;s customers are located throughout the United States, with a large concentration in the Northeastern&#13;and Southeastern United States regions.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;Mergers&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;On January 24, 2013, the Company, Mascot Properties&#13;Acquisition Corp, a Delaware corporation and wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company (&amp;#147;Merger Sub&amp;#148;), MamaMancini&amp;#146;s,&#13;Inc., a privately-held Delaware Corporation headquartered in New Jersey (&amp;#147;MamaMancini&amp;#146;s&amp;#148;) and an individual (the&#13;&amp;#147;Majority Shareholder&amp;#148;), entered into an Acquisition Agreement and Plan of Merger (the &amp;#147;Agreement&amp;#148;) pursuant&#13;to which the Merger Sub was merged with and into MamaMancini&amp;#146;s, with MamaMancini&amp;#146;s surviving as a wholly-owned subsidiary&#13;of the Company (the &amp;#147;Merger&amp;#148;). The Company acquired, through a reverse triangular merger, all of the outstanding capital&#13;stock of MamaMancini&amp;#146;s in exchange for issuing MamaMancini&amp;#146;s shareholders (the &amp;#147;MamaMancini&amp;#146;s Shareholders&amp;#148;),&#13;pro-rata, a total of 20,054,000 shares of the Company&amp;#146;s common stock. Immediately after the Merger was consummated, and further&#13;to the Agreement, the majority shareholders and certain affiliates of the Company cancelled a total of 103,408,000 shares of the&#13;Company&amp;#146;s common stock held by them (the &amp;#147;Cancellation&amp;#148;). In consideration of the Cancellation of such common&#13;stock, the Company paid the Majority Shareholder in aggregate of $295,000 and 800,000 shares of common stock and released the other&#13;affiliates from certain liabilities. In addition, the Company has agreed to spin out to the Majority Shareholder all assets related&#13;to the Company&amp;#146;s real estate management business within 30 days after the closing. As a result of the Merger and the Cancellation,&#13;the MamaMancini&amp;#146;s Shareholders became the majority shareholders of the Company.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The consolidated financial statements presented&#13;for all periods through and including December 31, 2013 are those of MamaMancini&amp;#146;s. As a result of this Merger, the equity&#13;sections of MamaMancini&amp;#146;s for all prior periods presented reflect the recapitalization described above and are consistent&#13;with the December 31, 2013 balance sheet presented for the Company.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Since the transaction is considered a reverse&#13;acquisition and recapitalization, the presentation of pro-forma financial information was not required.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;Basis of Presentation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;Note 10 - Income Tax Provision&#13;(Benefit)&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The income tax provision (benefit) consists&#13;of the following:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times

 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;State and Local&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right; line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right; line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Times
 Serif&gt;Deferred&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right; line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(361,363&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right; line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;-&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Change in valuation allowance&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: right; line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;1,306,652&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: right; line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;599,149&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Income tax provision (benefit)&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; text-align: right; line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;-&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; text-align: right; line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;-&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company has U.S. federal net operating&#13;loss carryovers (NOLs) of approximately $4.6M and $1.6M at December 31, 2013 and 2012, respectively, available to offset taxable&#13;income through 2033. If not used, these NOLs may be subject to limitation under Internal Revenue Code Section 382 should there&#13;be a greater than 50% ownership change as determined under the regulations. The Company plans on undertaking a detailed analysis&#13;of any historical and/or current Section 382 ownership changes that may limit the utilization of the net operating loss carryovers.&#13;The Company also has New Jersey State Net Operating Loss carry overs of $4.6M and $1.6M, as of December 31, 2013 and 2012, respectively,&#13;available to offset future taxable income through 2033.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;In assessing the realization of deferred&#13;tax assets, management considers whether it is more likely than not that some portion or all of the deferred tax assets will not&#13;be realized. The ultimate realization of deferred tax assets is dependent upon future generation for taxable income during the&#13;periods in which temporary differences representing net future deductible amounts become deductible. Management considers the scheduled&#13;reversal of deferred tax liabilities, projected future taxable income and tax planning strategies in making this assessment. After&#13;consideration of all the information available, Management believes that significant uncertainty exists with respect to future&#13;realization of the deferred tax assets and has therefore established a full valuation allowance. For the year ended December 31,&#13;2013 and 2012, the change in the valuation allowance was $1,306,652 and $599,149.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company evaluated the provisions&#13;of ASC 740 related to the accounting for uncertainty in income taxes recognized in an enterprise&amp;#146;s financial statements.&#13;ASC 740 prescribes a comprehensive model for how a company should recognize, present, and disclose uncertain positions that the&#13;Company has taken or expects to take in its tax return. For those benefits to be recognized, a tax position must be more-likely-than-not&#13;to be sustained upon examination by taxing authorities. Differences between tax positions taken or expected to be taken in a tax&#13;return and the net benefit recognized and measured pursuant to the interpretation are referred to as &amp;#147;unrecognized benefits.&amp;#148;&#13;A liability is recognized (or amount of net operating loss carry forward or amount of tax refundable is reduced) for unrecognized&#13;tax benefit because it represents an enterprise&amp;#146;s potential future obligation to the taxing authority for a tax position&#13;that was not recognized as a result of applying the provisions of ASC 740.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;If applicable, interest costs related&#13;to the unrecognized tax benefits are required to be calculated and would be classified as &amp;#147;Other expenses &amp;#150; Interest&amp;#148;&#13;in the statement of operations. Penalties would be recognized as a component of &amp;#147;General and administrative.&amp;#148;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;No interest or penalties on unpaid tax&#13;were recorded during the years ended December 31, 2013 and 2012, respectively. As of December 31, 2013 and 2012, no liability for&#13;unrecognized tax benefits was required to be reported. The Company does not expect any significant changes in its unrecognized&#13;tax benefits in the next year.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;The Company&amp;#146;s deferred tax assets&#13;(liabilities) consisted of the effects of temporary differences attributable to the following:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 10pt Calibri
 Helvetica

 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Years Ended&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: center; line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;Deferred Tax Assets&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: center; line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: center; line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;December 31, 2013&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: center; line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: center; line-height: 115%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: center; line-height: 115%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

Note 2 - Summary of Significant Accounting
Policies




have been eliminated in consolidation.




in conformity with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect
the amounts reported in the consolidated financial statements and accompanying notes. Such estimates and assumptions impact
 among
others
 the following: allowance for bad debt
 inventory obsolescence
 the fair value of share-based payments.


significant judgment. It is at least reasonably possible that the estimate of the effect of a condition
 situation or set of circumstances
that existed at the date of the consolidated financial statements
 which management considered in formulating its estimate could
change in the near term due to one or more future confirming events. Accordingly
 the actual results could differ significantly
from our estimates.




and change in consumer demand. The Company&#146;s operations are subject to significant risk and uncertainties including financial
and operational risks including the potential risk of business failure.


 and in the future
expects to continue to experience
 variability in sales and earnings. The factors expected to contribute to this variability include
among others
 (i) the cyclical nature of the grocery industry
 (ii) general economic conditions in the various local markets in
which the Company competes
 including the general downturn in the economy
 and (iii) the volatility of prices pertaining to food
and beverages in connection with the Company&#146;s distribution of the product. These factors
 among others
 make it difficult
to project the Company&#146;s operating results on a consistent basis.




purchased with a maturity of three months or less to be cash equivalents. The Company held no cash equivalents at December 31
2013 and December 31
 2012.


with cash by periodically evaluating the credit quality of its primary financial institution. The balance at times may exceed federally
insured limits.




management expects to collect from outstanding balances. The Company generally does not require collateral to support customer
receivables. The Company provides an allowance for doubtful accounts based upon a review of the outstanding accounts receivable
historical collection information and existing economic conditions. The Company determines if receivables are past due based on
days outstanding
 and amounts are written off when determined to be uncollectible by management. The maximum accounting loss from
the credit risk associated with accounts receivable is the amount of the receivable recorded
 which is the face amount of the receivable
net of the allowance for doubtful accounts. As of December 31
 2013 and 2012
 the Company had reserves of $2
000.




using the first-in
 first-out (FIFO) valuation method. Inventory was comprised of the following at December 31
 2013 and 2012:

at cost. Depreciation expense is computed using straight-line methods over the estimated useful lives.


of depreciation are:



    
    

    
    





 the
fair value of a financial instrument is the amount at which the instrument could be exchanged in a current transaction between
willing parties
 other than in a forced sale or liquidation. The carrying amount of the Company&#146;s short term financial instruments
approximates fair value due to the relatively short period to maturity for these instruments.




as incurred. Upon the completion of the offering
 the stock issuance costs are reclassified to equity. Offering costs recorded
to equity for the years ended December 31

604
000 and $1
088
964
 respectively.




as incurred. Research and development expenses for the years ended December 31

revenue and the related freight costs as cost of sales.




when all of the following have occurred: (1) persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists
 (2) the product is delivered
 (3) the
sales price to the customer is fixed or determinable
 and (4) collectability of the related customer receivable is reasonably assured.
There is no stated right of return for products.

related to the production and manufacturing of the Company&#146;s products. Costs include product development

advertising for the Company are charged to operations as incurred. Producing and communicating advertising expenses for the years

440

 respectively.




compensation in accordance with ASC Topic 718
 &#147;Accounting for Stock-Based Compensation&#148; (&#147;ASC 718&#148;) which
establishes financial accounting and reporting standards for stock-based employee compensation. It defines a fair value based method
of accounting for an employee stock option or similar equity instrument. The Company accounts for compensation cost for stock option
plans in accordance with ASC 718. The Company accounts for share based payments to non-employees in accordance with ASC 505-50
&#147;Accounting for Equity Instruments Issued to Non-Employees for Acquiring
 or in Conjunction with Selling Goods or Services&#148;.


share-based payments
 including stock option grants
 warrants and restricted stock grants
 at their fair value on the grant date
which are based on the estimated number of awards that are ultimately expected to vest.


 excluding restricted
stock
 are valued using a Black-Scholes option pricing model. Grants of share based payment awards issued to non-employees for
services rendered have been recorded at the fair value of the share-based payment
 which is the more readily determinable value.
The grants are amortized on a straight-line basis over the requisite service periods
 which is generally the vesting period. If
an award is granted
 but vesting does not occur
 any previously recognized compensation cost is reversed in the period related
to the termination of service. Stock based compensation expenses are included in cost of goods sold or selling
 general and administrative
expenses
 depending on the nature of the services provided
 in the Statement of Operations. For the years ended December 31
 2013
and 2012 share based compensation amounted to $894
827 and $438
122
 respectively.$731
894 of the $894
827 recorded for the year
ended December 31
 2013 was a direct cost of a stock offering and has been recorded as a reduction in additional paid in capital.
The $438
122 recorded for the year ended December 31
 2012 was a direct cost of a stock offering and has been recorded as a reduction
in additional paid in capital.


 2013
when computing fair value of share based payments
 the Company has considered the following variables:



    
    

    
    

    
    

    
    

    
    

    
    

    
    

    
    

    
    

    
    

    
The forfeiture rate is based on the historical forfeiture rate for the Company&#146;s unvested stock options
 which was 0%.

    
    

    
For the year ended December 31
 2012
 when computing fair value of share based payments
 the Company has considered the following variables:

    
    

    
    

    
    

    
    

    
    

    
    

    
    

    
    

    
    

    
Given the Company was privately held
 expected volatility was benchmarked against similar companies in a similar industry. The expected volatility used had a range of 128%-147%.

    
    

    
The forfeiture rate is based on the historical forfeiture rate for the Company&#146;s unvested stock options
 which was 0%.





by dividing net income (loss) by the weighted average number of shares of common stock outstanding during each period. Diluted
earnings (loss) per share is computed by dividing net income (loss)
 adjusted for changes in income or loss that resulted from
the assumed conversion of convertible shares
 by the weighted average number of shares of common stock
 common stock equivalents
and potentially dilutive securities outstanding during the period.

during the years ended December 31

 the effect of considering any common stock equivalents

A separate computation of diluted earnings (loss) per share is not presented.




Accounting for Income Taxes. A deferred tax asset or liability is recorded for all temporary differences between financial and
tax reporting and net operating loss carryforwards. Deferred tax expense (benefit) results from the net change during the period
of deferred tax assets and liabilities.


when
 in the opinion of management
 it is more likely than not that some portion or all of the deferred tax assets will not be
realized. Deferred tax assets and liabilities are adjusted for the effects of changes in tax laws and rates on the date of enactment.




that are expected to have an effect on the Company&#146;s financial statements.

after the balance sheet date through the date when the consolidated financial statements were issued to determine if they must
be reported. The Management of the Company determined that there were certain reportable subsequent events to be disclosed as follow.




 2014
 MamaMancini&#146;s
Inc. (&#147;Mama&#146;s&#148;) a Delaware corporation and wholly owned subsidiary of MamaMancini&#146;s Holdings
 Inc. (the
&#147;Company&#148;)
 entered into a Sale and Security Agreement (the &#147;Sale and Security Agreement&#148;) with Faunus
Group International
 Inc. (&#147;FGI&#148;) to provide for a $1.5 million secured demand credit facility backed by its receivables
and inventory (the &#147;FGI Facility&#148;). The Sale and Security Agreement has an initial three (3) year term (the &#147;Original
Term&#148;) and shall be extended automatically for an additional one (1) year for each succeeding term unless written notice
of termination is given by either party at least sixty (60) days prior to the end of the Original Term or any extension thereof.
The Company and certain of its affiliates also entered into guarantees to guarantee the performance of the obligations under the
Sale and Security Agreement (the &#147;Guaranty Agreements&#148;). Mama&#146;s also granted FGI a security interest in and lien
upon all of Mama&#146;s right
 title and interest in and to all of Mama&#146;s Collateral (as defined in the Sale and Security
Agreement).


 FGI can elect
to purchase eligible accounts receivables (&#147;Purchased Accounts&#148;) up to 70% of the value of such receivables (retaining
a 30% reserve). At FGI&#146;s election
 FGI may advance Mama&#146;s up to 70% of the value of any Purchased Accounts
 subject
to the FGI Facility. Reserves retained by FGI on any Purchased Accounts are expected to be refunded to Mama&#146;s net of interest
and fees on advances once the receivables are collected from customers. The interest rate on advances or borrowings under the FGI
Facility will be the greater of (i) 6.75% per annum and (ii) 2.50% above the rate of interest designated by FGI as its selected
&#147;Prime Rate&#148; or &#147;Base Rate&#146;
 as the case may be (which as of the date hereof is based upon the Wall Street
Journal
 Money Rates Section). Any advances or borrowings under the FGI Facility are due on demand.


collateral management fees of 0.42% of the average monthly balance of Purchased Accounts. The minimum monthly net funds employed
during each contract year hereof shall be $500
000. Additionally
 Mama&#146;s paid FGI a one-time facility fee equal to 1% of
the FGI Facility upon entry into the Sale and Security Agreement.


by the Company on January 10
 2014.




 2014
 MamaMancini&#146;s
Holdings
 Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;) changed its fiscal year-end date to January 31. The Company&#146;s 2014 fiscal year
shall commence on February 1
 2014 and conclude on January 31
 2015. The Company will file an Annual Report on Form 10-K for the
year ended December 31
 2013 and will also file a transitional report with the United States Securities and Exchange Commission
for the period of January 1
 2014 to January 31
 2014.




 2014 through March 14
 2014
the Company issued 536
667 shares of common stock to investors in exchange for $805
000 in proceeds in connection with the private
placement of the Company&#146;s stock. The Company incurred approximately $104
650 in stock issuance costs in conjunction with
the placement and issued Spartan 53
667 five year warrants with an exercise price of $1.50.

interest in Meatball Obsession
 LLC (&#147;MO&#148;) for a total investment of $27
032. This investment is accounted for using
the equity method of accounting. Accordingly
 investments are recorded at acquisition cost plus the Company&#146;s equity in the
undistributed earnings or losses of the entity. At December 31
 2011 the investment was brought down to $0 due to losses incurred
by MO.


interest in MO fell to 28% due to dilution.

on July 8

 2010 the Company signed

000
000. The available balance of
this Note was reduced to $400
000 and extended to September 1
 2013. The outstanding balance accrues interest at a variable rate
of 1.00% over the Wall Street Journal prime rate with a floor of 4.50% per annum. (Starting July 2013 the interest rate floor increased
to 5%) Interest is payable monthly and the rate as of December 31
 2012 was 4.50%.


receivables (75 days from invoice) and 35% of finished goods inventory (Starting July 2013 advances are limited to 70% of eligible

000. Concentrations from any one customer exceeding 30% of total accounts
